results.title: Orchestra rehearsal = Prova d'orchestra
results.creator_credit: Radiotelevisione Italiana, Albatros Produktion and Federico Fellini
results.brief_description: A television crew arrives to film the members of an orchestra rehearsing. The various musicians bicker and debate the merits of their individual contributions. Performing for the camera, they begin to challenge the authority of the conducter. As the situation turns chaotic and their rehearsal room begins to be demolished by a building crew, they all turn to the conductor for the restablishment of order. Maintaining a finely absurd comic tone throughout, “Orchestra Rehearsal” is a celebration of the meditative power of music and art. It is also a witty parable on the entropic contradictions that are threatening to tear modern Italy apart. With this short but elegant film, Fellini signalled a retreat from the lavish carnivalesque cinema he explored in the Sixties and Seventies. However, this does not mean this is not a suberbly directed work. In fact this was a return to form for Fellini, and his concern with the meaning and function of art in an increasingly alienated society is more expressively explored in “Orchestra Rehearsal” than it has been in any other film since “8 1/2”.

results.title: Orchestra of rust
results.brief_description: ‘Orchestra of rust’ is an installation based interactive that allows the user to create soundscapes and musical pieces via the medium of an entropic industrial environment. The user can explore a zone of decay within an old factory that contains a selection of obsolete machinery. Operating these machines creates particular sounds and corresponding animated sequences. Complex sound structures can be built up from turning on several machines at once. This provides access to other zones of the factory where remixes of the musical creations exist. Also included is extensive interactive information on the background of the machines and sounds, historical sources and concept rationale/hypothesis.

results.title: Orbost v Orbost
results.creator_credit: John Sparkes, David Wood and ABC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Big country”.
Orbost in Victoria is a fairly normal country town, but it has one outstanding feature - two football clubs. Every winter, football becomes the focal point in the lives of most of the local people, and it provides a good deal of their social life. In this film the two local teams compete in the district final, and football fever reaches its highest pitch.

results.title: Orbital shapes and paths
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Space Science”.
How is a satellite placed in a desired orbit? The program explores this problem by illustrating how a satellite’s shape, path and period may be modified. Practical application of this procedure - the establishing of weather and communications satellites - is demonstrated as students are given a satellite’s eye view of the various paths over the earth’s surface.

results.brief_description: Looks at the orbital internal combustion engine devised by Ralph Sarich. Shows details of the engine’s assembly.

results.title: Oranges are not the only fruit
results.creator_credit: Phillippa Giles, Second Sight Television and Beeban Kidron
results.brief_description: Jeannette Winterson adapted the screenplay for this BBC television series from her semi-autobiographical best-selling novel of the same name. The series follows the story of Jess (Charlotte Coleman), a young girl, and her relationships with her adoptive mother - an outrageously fanatical Evangelist; the church - including an equally devout pastor and flock; and the people of her small township in Northern England. In accordance with her mother’s wishes, Jess is set to train as a missionary. However, when her relationship with local girl, Melanie, is exposed as more than friendship, ensuing tensions propel Jess’ arduous journey of self-discovery on a more difficult and changed trajectory than she had planned. The story of Jess’ hardwon escape from the township is treated with both tragedy and black humour. This series won three BAFTA awards including Best Serial and Best Actress.

results.title: Oranges and lemons
results.creator_credit: Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School and Margot Lethlean
results.brief_description: A documentary on the early education of aboriginal children. It looks at a special pre-school program to help prepare aboriginal children for school, which has been set up in Dareton, Victoria. It suggests that in the face of insensitive attitudes, conventional education will further undermine aboriginal culture.

results.title: Orange and blue
results.creator_credit: Contemporary Films, Harvard Film Service, Harvard University, Peter Chermayeff and Jane Chermayeff
results.brief_description: Two coloured balls embark on an adventure as they travel through rural and industrial settings. The skilled animation and complimentary soundtrack gives the balls entertaining personalities. Music by Joseph Raposos.

results.title: Orange
results.brief_description: Nature’s element - the movements of sun, clouds, light and shadows play the leading roles in this film. We witness the virth of a day when the first glow of morning grows to a blinding red of boiling clouds. Into this primordial atmosphere intrudes man’s machines, aeroplanes - nature rebels with explosive holocaust. Made with the assistance of the Creative Development Branch of the Australian Film Commission.
